description: The project selection subsystem is designed to unify multiple entry points for identifying a target codebase. Inputs may originate from a local command-line interface (CLI), a FastAPI-based REST service, or an automated GitHub Action. Each of these sources provides project-identifying information—such as a local path, repository URL, or branch name—to a centralized `Project Selector`. The Project Selector normalizes these inputs and relies on shared `Git Utils` to resolve repositories, branches, and working directories, producing a consistent project context for downstream analysis.

components.name: CLI Setup
components.description: Provides a local, developer-facing interface for configuring and launching analysis. It captures the project’s local filesystem location and forwards it to the Project Selector.

components.name: FastAPI REST
components.description: Exposes an HTTP-based API for remote or service-driven usage. It accepts inputs such as a GitHub repository URL and forwards them to the Project Selector for resolution.

components.name: GitHub Action
components.description: Enables automated invocation from CI/CD pipelines. It supplies GitHub-specific context—such as repository metadata and branch names—to the Project Selector.

components.name: Git Utils
components.description: Provides low-level utilities for interacting with Git repositories. This includes cloning repositories, checking out branches, resolving commit states, and preparing working directories for analysis.
